ModuleDescription: This module considers questions of international politics historically and philosophically, based on reading classical and modern works. The topics discussed include sovereignty and intervention, the morality of war, the balance of power, imperialism and decolonization, and conceptions of international law and global order. Attention is given to non-European thinkers and to recent work on the intellectual history of international relations.
Prerequisite: YCC1114 Philosophy and Political Thought 2 or with the permission of the instructor
